title.native: 名探偵コナン エピソード"ONE" 小さくなった名探偵
title.english: Case Closed: Episode One - The Great Detective Turned Small

description:
A special commemorating the 20th anniversary of the anime series. The special is a retelling of how Kudo Shinichi was transformed into a child.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Detektiv Conan: Episode ONE - Der geschrumpfte Meisterdetektiv

name.native: ジョディ・スターリング

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉原俊一郎)

Affiliated with studio Bihou.
**Mao Ueki** is a Japanese CG artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上慶子)

Daughter of [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/). Sister of [Yasuyuki Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/144509/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上靖之)

Son of [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/). Brother of [Keiko Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/162367/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suwacchi)

Michihiko is a producer, planner and supervisor. He is a chief producer at Yomiuri Telecasting Corporation.

[Website](https://wezard.net/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Sakai) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/坂井泉水)

Sachiko Kamachi, known professionally as Izumi Sakai, was a female Japanese pop singer, songwriter, and member of the group Zard. As Sakai was the only member who stayed in the group while others joined and left regularly, Zard and Sakai may be referred to interchangeably. She was the best-selling female recording artist of the 1990s and has sold over 37 million copies of sales, making her one of the best-selling music artists in Japan of all time.

Sakai produced 42 singles as well as 11 albums and 5 compilations in her lifetime. In addition to "Makenaide," she produced two other singles that sold over a million copies. Six of her albums as well as her first three compilations also surpassed the one-million mark. Sakai's CD sales had been in decline since 2000, but her death triggered an increase in CD sales.

 In June 2006, she was diagnosed with cervical cancer, for which she immediately underwent treatment. She appeared to have healed, but discovered that her cancer had spread to her lungs, indicating a Stage 4 cancer. She began undergoing treatment at Keio University Hospital in April 2007 but she never fully recovered. Sakai died on May 27, 2007 due to an accidental fall at the hospital where she was undergoing chemotherapy.

(Source: Wikipedia)

The High-Lows were a popular Japanese punk rock band that was formed in 1995. The band stopped all activities in November 2005 and broke up. The band was popular since the very beginning, as vocalist Koumoto Hiroto and guitarist Mashima Masatoshi were both central members in THE BLUE HEARTS, which had recently broken up. The band consisted of vocalist Koumoto Hiroto, guitarrist Mashima Masatoshi, bassist Shirabe Sakito, drummer Oshima Kenji and keyboardist Shirai Mikio. This lineup remained the same until 2003 when Shirai Mikio —whowas also related to The Blue Hearts, for which he had been a support member— left the band.

__Birthplace:__ Hino City, Tokyo, Japan
__Hometown:__ Kodaira City, Tokyo, Japan

__Masatoshi Mashima__ is a Japanese guitarist, lyricist and composer, who has performed with Japanese rock bands such as The Blue Hearts, The High-Lows and The Cro-Magnons.

[Website](https://wezard.net/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Sakai) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/坂井泉水)

Sakai produced 42 singles as well as 11 albums and 5 compilations in her lifetime. In addition to "Makenaide," she produced two other singles that sold over a million copies. She appeared to have healed, but discovered that her cancer had spread to her lungs, indicating a Stage 4 cancer. The High-Lows were a popular Japanese punk rock band that was formed in 1995. The band stopped all activities in November 2005 and broke up. The band was popular since the very beginning, as vocalist Koumoto Hiroto and guitarist Mashima Masatoshi were both central members in THE BLUE HEARTS, which had recently broken up. The band consisted of vocalist Koumoto Hiroto, guitarrist Mashima Masatoshi, bassist Shirabe Sakito, drummer Oshima Kenji and keyboardist Shirai Mikio. This lineup remained the same until 2003 when Shirai Mikio —whowas also related to The Blue Hearts, for which he had been a support member— left the band.

__Height:__ 174cm
__Relatives:__ [Masahiro Koumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100407/Masahiro-Koumoto) (Brother)

__[Profile (Sony Music)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/kohmoto_hiroto/)__

__Introduction:__
Hiroto Koumoto is a Japanese guitarist, bassist, drummer, vocalist, lyricist and composer, who has fronted bands such as The Blue Hearts, The High-Lows and The Cro-Magnons. 

__Biography:__
He went to Hosei University, Department of Economics, where he eventually dropped out. He is also the older brother of the actor Masahiro Koumoto.
Seiichirou Kuribayashi is a former Japanese musical composer, keyboardist, singer-songwriter, bassist and guitarist under Vermillion records label.
